noun.description: A dangerous, difficult, or otherwise unfortunate situation.
examples: we must direct our efforts toward relieving the plight of children living in poverty

verb.description: Pledge or promise solemnly (one's faith or loyalty)
examples: men to plighted vows were faithful

origin: Old English plihtan endanger, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch plicht and German Pflicht duty. The current sense is recorded only from Middle English, but is probably original, in view of the related Germanic words.
